name: Card Match (itch) (Knightmare Games)
description:
A match card game is a type of card game in which players try to find pairs of cards that match each other based on some shared attribute, such as suit, rank, or color. There are many variations of match card games, and they can be played with a standard deck of playing cards or with a special deck of cards designed specifically for the game. Some common match card games include Memory, Concentration, and Go Fish.

 

To play a match card game, each player is usually dealt a certain number of cards, which they then try to match with cards held by other players or with cards that have been laid out on the table. Players take turns drawing cards and trying to find matches, with the goal of collecting the most pairs of matching cards. Some match card games may have additional rules, such as allowing players to draw from a central pile or requiring players to ask specific questions to other players in order to try to find a match.

  Match card games are popular with children and adults alike, and they can be played by people of all ages. They are often used as a learning tool to help children develop memory and concentration skills, and they can be a fun and engaging way to pass the time with friends and family.
